I am a student seeking counseling

or, I'm here in behalf of some one else

We are glad you are here, and we look forward to helping you achieve your counseling goals. As you begin counseling, the following information will help you to understand what services you can expect from your counselor and what responsibilities you will be expected to assume. Please read the following information carefully and jot down any questions you might have so that you can discuss them with your counselor.

About Counseling

Counseling requires a very active effort on your part. To gain the greatest benefit, you will have to work both during your counseling sessions and between sessions. Counseling may sometimes arouse uncomfortable feelings; however it also may result in many benefits. For example, you may significantly reduce feelings of distress, experience more satisfaction in your relationships, and increase understanding of your personal goals and values.

During your first session, your counselor will work with you to determine the most appropriate form of treatment for your issues. Your counselor will work with you to determine the most appropriate form of treatment for your issues. Your counselor may recommend that you participate in individual, group, or couples counseling. If medication is indicated, your counselor can refer you to the Health Center or to the psychiatrist who works with the Counseling Center. If nutrition counseling is recommended by your counselor he/she will arrange a referral to the Counseling Center's registered dietician.

Your counselor has a limited number of times available for counseling. You will be expected to regularly attend the sessions that are scheduled for you. If you miss your scheduled appointment without canceling ahead of time, another student may be put in your place. When you want to see your counselor again, you may have to wait for a new opening to become available.

To schedule an appointment with a counselor, simply call (208) 496-9370.

Confidentiality

Anything that you and your counselor discuss will be held in strict confidence. Your counselor may occasionally consult with another Counseling Center Counselor or with the consulting psychiatrist. Sometimes, for the purpose of improving the quality of services provided at the Counseling Center, your counselor may ask for your consent to record your sessions. Your counselor will release no information concerning you or your treatment to persons outside the Counseling Center except under special conditions.

Crisis Service

In an emergency during evening or weekend hours call 496-HELP (496-4357). Be sure to tell the crisis worker the name of your counselor. During weekdays, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., phone the Counseling Center at 496-9370 and tell the receptionist that it is an emergency.
